thread.title: India vs SA 5th ODI: Records tumbled at Wankhede Stadium
thread.title_full: India vs SA 5th ODI: Records tumbled at Wankhede Stadium

title: India vs SA 5th ODI: Records tumbled at Wankhede Stadium
text:
South Africa piled up a mammoth total of 438/4 on the boards in the limited 50 overs thanks to some sheer hitting by AB de Villiers , Faf du Plessis and Quinton de Kock. 
Here are the moments and figures that made it to the game's history books: Faf du Plessis (133 retired hurt), AB de Villiers (119) and Quinton de Kock (109). 2nd time when three batsmen scored a century each in an ODI match. SA players had done it earlier this year too. ( 3 'Ds' propel South Africa to 438/4 in decider ) 1st ODI century for Faf du Plessis against India. AB de Villiers' 119 most runs scored by a visiting captain against India. AB de Villiers becomes the first ever player to hit 10+ sixes in an ODI innings as a captain on two separate occasions. First time India is chasing a target of 400+ in ODIs. ( Twitterati mock 'centurion' Bhuvneshwar Kumar ) This is also the highest ODI score by a visiting team in India (batting first). 144 runs are the most India have conceded in last 10 overs (41-50). Previous record was 135 also vs SA in 2013. With 1/106, Bhuvneshwar Kumar has recorded the second-most expensive spell of bowling in ODI history; worst bowling performance by an Indian. With 438 at Wankhede, South Africa now have scored 400+ six times in ODIs history, the most by any team beating India (5 times). 438 is the highest ever total at the Wankhede, a previous record held by New Zealand against Canada during 2011 World Cup where the Kiwis scored 358 for 6 in 50 overs. 100th Catch for Raina and He became only fourth Indian fielder after Azhar, Sachin & Dravid to achieve this in ODI. Hashim Amla completes fastest 6000 runs in ODI by taking just 123 innings, leaving Kohli (136 innings) behind.
